verses.verse: In his days <S%H3117><s%> Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> came up, <S%H5927><s%> and Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> became <S%H1961><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> years: <S%H8141><s%> then he turned <S%H7725><s%> and rebelled <S%H4775><s%> against him.

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> against him <S%H853><s%> bands <S%H1416><s%> of the Chaldees, <S%H3778><s%> and bands <S%H1416><s%> of the Syrians, <S%H758><s%> and bands <S%H1416><s%> of the Moabites, <S%H4124><s%> and bands <S%H1416><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon, <S%H5983><s%> and sent <S%H7971><s%> them against Judah <S%H3063><s%> to destroy <S%H6><s%> it, according to the word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he spoke <S%H1696><s%> by <S%H3027><s%> his servants <S%H5650><s%> the prophets. <S%H5030><s%>

Surely <S%H389><s%> at <S%H5921><s%> the commandment <S%H6310><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> this upon Judah, <S%H3063><s%> to remove <S%H5493><s%> them out of <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> his sight, <S%H6440><s%> for the sins <S%H2403><s%> of Manasseh, <S%H4519><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he did; <S%H6213><s%>

And also <S%H1571><s%> for the innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he shed: <S%H8210><s%> for he filled <S%H4390><s%> <S%H853><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> with innocent <S%H5355><s%> blood; <S%H1818><s%> which the LORD <S%H3068><s%> would <S%H14><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> pardon. <S%H5545><s%>

Now the rest <S%H3499><s%> of the acts <S%H1697><s%> of Jehoiakim, <S%H3079><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> he did, <S%H6213><s%> are they <S%H1992><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> written <S%H3789><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> the book <S%H5612><s%> of the chronicles <S%H1697><s%> <S%H3117><s%> of the kings <S%H4428><s%> of Judah? <S%H3063><s%>
So Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> slept <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> his fathers: <S%H1><s%> and Jehoiachin <S%H3078><s%> his son <S%H1121><s%> reigned <S%H4427><s%> in his stead. <S%H8478><s%>

And the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> again <S%H3254><s%> any more <S%H5750><s%> out of his land: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H776><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> had taken <S%H3947><s%> from the river <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5104><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> unto <S%H5704><s%> the river <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5158><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> pertained <S%H1961><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Jehoiachin <S%H3078><s%> was eighteen <S%H8083><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> months. <S%H2320><s%> And his mother's <S%H517><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> was Nehushta, <S%H5179><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Elnathan <S%H494><s%> of Jerusalem. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3389><s%>

And he did <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> had done. <S%H6213><s%>

At that <S%H1931><s%> time <S%H6256><s%> the servants <S%H5650><s%> of Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> against Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and the city <S%H5892><s%> was besieged. <S%H935><s%> <S%H4692><s%>

And Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> came <S%H935><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the city, <S%H5892><s%> and his servants <S%H5650><s%> did besiege <S%H6696><s%> <S%H5921><s%> it.

And Jehoiachin <S%H3078><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> to <S%H5921><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> he, <S%H1931><s%> and his mother, <S%H517><s%> and his servants, <S%H5650><s%> and his princes, <S%H8269><s%> and his officers: <S%H5631><s%> and the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> him in the eighth <S%H8083><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of his reign. <S%H4427><s%>

And he carried out <S%H3318><s%> thence <S%H4480><s%> <S%H8033><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the king's <S%H4428><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and cut in pieces <S%H7112><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the vessels <S%H3627><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Solomon <S%H8010><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> had made <S%H6213><s%> in the temple <S%H1964><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> as <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had said. <S%H1696><s%>

And he carried away <S%H1540><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the princes, <S%H8269><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the mighty men <S%H1368><s%> of valor, <S%H2428><s%> even ten <S%H6235><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> captives, <S%H1540><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the craftsmen <S%H2796><s%> and smiths: <S%H4525><s%> none <S%H3808><s%> remained, <S%H7604><s%> save <S%H2108><s%> the poorest sort <S%H1803><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>

And he carried away <S%H1540><s%> <S%H853><s%> Jehoiachin <S%H3078><s%> to Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and the king's <S%H4428><s%> mother, <S%H517><s%> and the king's <S%H4428><s%> wives, <S%H802><s%> and his officers, <S%H5631><s%> and the mighty <S%H352><s%> of the land, <S%H776><s%> those carried <S%H1980><s%> he into captivity <S%H1473><s%> from Jerusalem <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3389><s%> to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

And all <S%H3605><s%> the men <S%H376><s%> of might, <S%H2428><s%> even seven <S%H7651><s%> thousand, <S%H505><s%> and craftsmen <S%H2796><s%> and smiths <S%H4525><s%> a thousand, <S%H505><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that were strong <S%H1368><s%> and apt <S%H6213><s%> for war, <S%H4421><s%> even them the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> captive <S%H1473><s%> to Babylon. <S%H894><s%>

And the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> made <S%H4427><s%> <S%H853><s%> Mattaniah <S%H4983><s%> his father's brother <S%H1730><s%> king <S%H4427><s%> in his stead, <S%H8478><s%> and changed <S%H5437><s%> <S%H853><s%> his name <S%H8034><s%> to Zedekiah. <S%H6667><s%>

Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> was twenty <S%H6242><s%> and one <S%H259><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> old <S%H1121><s%> when he began to reign, <S%H4427><s%> and he reigned <S%H4427><s%> eleven <S%H259><s%> <S%H6240><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> in Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> And his mother's <S%H517><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> was Hamutal, <S%H2537><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> of Libnah. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3841><s%>

And he did <S%H6213><s%> that which was evil <S%H7451><s%> in the sight <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that <S%H834><s%> Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> had done. <S%H6213><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> through <S%H5921><s%> the anger <S%H639><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> it came to pass <S%H1961><s%> in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> and Judah, <S%H3063><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> he had cast them out <S%H7993><s%> <S%H853><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> his presence, <S%H6440><s%> that Zedekiah <S%H6667><s%> rebelled <S%H4775><s%> against the king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon. <S%H894><s%>
